title: Fix TestValidateAgentID failing tests for witness_alone and refinery_alone
description:
The TestValidateAgentID tests expect 'gt-witness' and 'gt-refinery' to be invalid agent IDs, but ValidateAgentID currently accepts them as valid.

Failing tests:
- TestValidateAgentID/witness_alone: ValidateAgentID("gt-witness") error = <nil>, wantError true
- TestValidateAgentID/refinery_alone: ValidateAgentID("gt-refinery") error = <nil>, wantError true

Either:
1. The validation logic needs to be fixed to reject these IDs
2. Or the test expectations need to be updated if these IDs are actually valid

This was discovered while fixing bd-3q6.9/bd-3q6.10 (invalid issue type merge-request).

title: Sling Pipeline E2E Test Deviances
description: Tracking deviances found during E2E test of: sling -> polecat -> refinery -> groblegark main -> installation

title: Refinery startup times out waiting for runtime prompt
description: gt refinery start beads consistently times out with: 'timeout waiting for runtime prompt'. Prevents automated MR processing.
close_reason: Fixed: changed ReadyPromptPrefix from ASCII > to Unicode ‚ùØ (U+276F)

title: Auto-import fails: invalid issue type 'merge-request'
description: Auto-import shows: 'validation failed for issue: invalid issue type: merge-request'. MR beads created with issue_type='merge-request' which isn't a valid type. Should use 'task' with gt:merge-request label instead.

title: Sling shows 'bead not found' error but spawns polecat anyway
description: gt sling <bead> beads --create shows 'Error: checking bead status: bead not found' but the polecat is spawned and working. Race condition between DB check and spawn.
close_reason: Fixed: warn instead of error when bead check fails after polecat already spawned

title: Polecat worktree missing CLAUDE.md context
description: Fresh polecat worktree has no CLAUDE.md. When gt prime is run, Claude doesn't recognize it. Context injection not working for fresh polecats. Witness had to nudge with basic instructions.
close_reason: Fixed: ensure settings in account config dir when RuntimeConfigDir is set

title: Polecat beads DB shows 'invalid format version'
description: bd show <bead> in polecat worktree fails with 'failed to load database at /home/ubuntu/gastown9/.beads/dolt/beads with error: invalid format version'. Polecat can't read work details from beads DB.

title: gt done times out (exit 143) but work still submitted
description: gt done command times out after 2m with exit code 143 (SIGTERM), but the output shows work was successfully submitted. Misleading error status despite success.
close_reason: Expected behavior: gt done kills session after submitting work. Claude Code reports this as timeout but work completes successfully. The exit 143 (SIGTERM) is from session termination, not a failure.

title: MR bead missing gt:merge-request label on creation
description: Warning during gt done: 'MR bead missing gt:merge-request label, adding explicitly'. Label should be added automatically when MR bead is created.
close_reason: Investigation: gastown passes --labels=gt:merge-request correctly. Issue may be in bd create handling or was self-corrected by Claude. Low priority - work proceeds.

title: Agent bead not found when updating active_mr
description: Warning during gt done: 'could not update agent bead with active_mr: issue not found'. Agent bead bd-beads-polecat-onyx may not exist or has wrong ID format.
close_reason: Agent bead lookup issue - related to bd-3q6.4 (database routing). Polecat works despite warning.

title: Refinery not auto-creating GitHub PRs
description: With refinery not starting, PRs are not automatically created for polecat branches. Had to manually create PR using gh cli. Refinery is critical path for automated merge flow.
close_reason: User clarified: GitHub PRs not needed - just merge queue items. Refinery processes merge queue, not GitHub PRs. Not a bug.

title: bd import warning on git pull after merge
description: After git pull of merged PR, warning: 'Failed to import bd changes after merge. Run bd import -i .beads/issues.jsonl manually'. Auto-import after merge not working.

title: Verify JSONL export is fully disabled in dolt-native mode
description:
## Goal
Ensure JSONL export is completely disabled when sync.mode=dolt-native.

## Background
In dolt-native mode, Dolt is the source of truth and JSONL files should not be created/updated. The `ShouldExportJSONL()` function already returns false for dolt-native mode, but need to verify:

1. `bd sync` doesn't write to issues.jsonl in dolt-native mode
2. Auto-flush doesn't export JSONL in dolt-native mode
3. Pre-commit hook doesn't export JSONL in dolt-native mode
4. Daemon export functions respect dolt-native mode

## Verification Steps
1. Set sync.mode=dolt-native
2. Create/modify a bead
3. Run bd sync
4. Verify issues.jsonl was NOT modified

## Related
- bd-epy: ensureStoreActive ignores backend config

title: ensureStoreActive ignores backend config, breaks Dolt mode
description:
## Problem
`ensureStoreActive()` in `cmd/bd/direct_mode.go:92` hardcodes `sqlite.New(path)` instead of using the factory to respect backend configuration.

When backend is Dolt:
- `FindDatabasePath()` correctly returns the dolt directory path
- But `ensureStoreActive()` passes this path to `sqlite.New()`
- SQLite tries to open the directory as a file and fails

## Error
```
Error: failed to initialize direct mode: failed to open database: failed to enable WAL mode: sqlite3: unable to open database file: open /home/ubuntu/gastown9/.beads/dolt: is a directory
```

## Fix
Replace:
```go
sqlStore, err := sqlite.New(getRootContext(), path)
```

With factory usage that respects backend config:
```go
beadsDir := filepath.Dir(path)
store, err := factory.NewFromConfig(getRootContext(), beadsDir)
```
